Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to two random disengaged enemy units. And then, one friendly unit gets LV+2 and DF+5.

Skill0.Name: Rusted Solid
Skill0.Comment: This unit cannot use Rest or Iczer Attack. This unit can do nothing but Stand Steadfast until it Breaks Free.

Skill1.Name: Break Free
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/0 copies of this unit in the File/unit has not Broken Free] This unit gets HP=30, AT=LVX10, AGI=3 and Breaks Free.

Skill2.Name: Stand Steadfast
Skill2.Comment: This unit gets LV+1.

Skill3.Name: Full Charge
Skill3.Comment: [conditional use/LV 6 or higher] Do [damage: 50%AT] to two random enemy units in range.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Thanks Pop, it's just what I wanted!'
FlavorText.Text2: During recent years, it has become customary to give toys to children during the annual Yule celebration in the Solar Kingdom. A number of craftsmen have begin making intricate toys with moving parts. This is a toy of a 'Holy Colossus' that fought the 'Devil's Iron Soldiers' during the ancient history of Lavato.

Soul.Name: Spell Distruption
Soul.Comment: Send two random grimoire cards of level 3 or lower from rival Iczer's Card File to the Cemetery.

Skill0.Name: Spell Reflection
Skill0.Comment: This unit cannot be affected, targeted, or randomly chosen by Grimoires.

Skill1.Name: Grimoire Bane
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to a random enemy in range.  Select a random Grimoire from rival's file and send it to the Cemetery.

FlavorText.Text1: 'With, this I've collected one of each troop that defended the gates.'
FlavorText.Text2: Since the end of the War of the Sun and Moon, giving toys to children has become a tradition. Rather than focus on heroes, in the new Wizard Kingdom, the toys usually represent knights and soldiers from various divisions that fought during the fall of Regus. Using them, they re-enact famous moments from their history books and build elaborate dioramas.

Soul.Name: Sister and Brother United
Soul.Comment: One random unit gets DF+10.

Skill0.Name: Bond of Silver Wings
Skill0.Comment: Friendly [card: Twin Wing Knight / Bistya] gets AT+10 and DF+10. All friendly [subtype: solar kingdom] units are healed 10 HP.

Skill1.Name: Winged Rebirth
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/battletime morning] Return one random level 2 unit card from your Cemetery to your Card File.

FlavorText.Text1: 'I would not dress like this for any amount of money...'
FlavorText.Text2: Glosfiea is a member of the royal guard and often is responsible for Princess Aliria's safety. On one occasion, she had to dress up in order to escort Aliria to a winter ball in a neighboring kingdom. 'I found her more interesting when she was dressed as a boy,' commented her immediate superior, Rubens.

Soul.Name: Tome of Missions
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: number of grimoires in rival Iczer's Card File X 15] to target enemy unit.

Skill0.Name: Magic Seal Barrier
Skill0.Comment: This unit cannot be affected, targeted, or randomly chosen by Grimoires.

Skill1.Name: Magic Seal Power
Skill1.Comment: This unit gets AT+ [number of grimoires in your File X 10] for this turn. If this unit has AT 30 or higher, send one random grimoire from your Card File to the Cemetery.

Skill2.Name: Double Shock Strike
Skill2.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to two random enemy units in range.

FlavorText.Text1: 'I will wield this sword in the name of my lord.'
FlavorText.Text2: Mikasha is a legend for searching the entire world for magic and building with it an enormous magic library. But before then, she was just a knight serving a good king. She was mild-mannered, intelligent, and well-liked. But on one bitter winter day, the kingdom's borders were breached and disaster followed. When next seen, she was a wanderer with a mission.

Soul.Name: Settled on the Battlefield
Soul.Comment: Subtract 30 directly from the MAX HP of target enemy unit. You get SP+1.

Skill0.Name: What Legends are Made of
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets AT+ [HP of target enemy unit] for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Unleash Heroine's Sword
Skill1.Comment: [Conditional use /AT100 or higher] Remove target enemy unit within range from the game. This unit gets AT=0.

Skill2.Name: Last Survivor of Gabilab
Skill2.Comment: Target friendly unit with HP of 1 or higher gets HP=0. And then, this unit is fully healed.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Someday, I want to wear a beautiful dress like that.'
FlavorText.Text2: In times past, one brave girl was chosen to fight for the fate of the world. But is it fair that a savior of humanity like her never got the chance to live a normal life? Sometimes, the image of a day like the one pictured here dances in the edges of her imagination. Even on days like this, when she must confront the enemies of all who live. <Kickstarter Exclusive>

Skill0.Name: Boulder Drop
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to all units in [area: 4-5-6] on both sides of the field.

FlavorText.Text1: During the 2013 Kickstarter, Zach contributed his take on the card 'Boulder Drop.' www.smbc-comics.com/
FlavorText.Text2: Zach Wiener is a professional comic writer and comedian. Leave it to him to make a card that just screams 'So as near as I can tell, these Gowen guys are a loose federation of monsters, pixies, dinosaurs, goblins and hairy, shirtless men.' <Kickstarter Exclusive>

Soul.Name: Unleash the Wildfires
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: your Gowen level x 20] to one unit.

Skill0.Name: Flame Hand
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: your Gowen level X 5] to one unit.

Skill1.Name: Burning Purge
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to all enemy units in range.

Skill2.Name: Judgement of Hell's Fire
Skill2.Comment: Do [damage: your Gowen LV X20] to one enemy unit in range.

FlavorText.Text1: During the 2013 Kickstarter, Tim contributed his take on the card 'Efreet.' www.cad-comic.com
FlavorText.Text2: Tim is one of the most popular artists in his field and he's gone all out to create an impressive Efreet. You can check out the video of his creative process here: http://youtu.be/wn3UWCRldpA <Kickstarter Exclusive>

Soul.Name: Assign Folrart Deputies
Soul.Comment: All friendly units get DF=999 for this turn.

Skill0.Name: Captain's Orders
Skill0.Comment: All friendly [subtype: Solar Kingdom] units get AT+10 and DF+5 for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Shield Breaker
Skill1.Comment: Set a random enemy in range to DF=0 and do [damage: AT] to it.

FlavorText.Text1: During the 2013 Kickstarter, Woody contributed his take on the card 'Folrart Knight Captain.' www.gucomics.com
FlavorText.Text2: As the illustrator of a comic about gamers that has done more than it's share of World of Warcraft and other fantasy game strips, Woody is no stranger to armored knights.

Soul.Name: For the King
Soul.Comment: One friendly non-[subtype: Undead] of level 3 or lower gets MAX HP+30, HP+30 and DF+20.

Skill0.Name: Lancer of Souls
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT+10] to a random column of enemies. Rival gets SP-1.

Skill1.Name: Blood Price
Skill1.Comment: Set a target friendly's MAX HP=0. Then, do [damage: selected unit's AT X2] to target enemy in range.

Skill2.Name: Prodigy's Mark
Skill2.Comment: All friendlies get AT+5 for this turn, except this unit.

FlavorText.Text1: It's for the realization of everlasting peace.  Both my mind and body are King Verlaat's.'
FlavorText.Text2: The commander of the Solar Kingdom's Shrine Knights.  She's a young swordswoman prodigy who Saber Saint Lapierre had to admit is 'a true genius'.  She uses her overwhelming fighting strength to pulverize any enemy who opposes Folrart.  Due to being rescued when she was young, she sees Verlaat as something akin to a god, and she's even willing to sacrifice her life for him.  She departs for the front to fight the Cursed Legions, which have begun to operate actively.

Soul.Name: Execute Plan
Soul.Comment: All units get AT=0 for this turn.

Skill0.Name: Strategic Maneuver
Skill0.Comment: Target friendly gets AT+10, DF+10 and AGI-2 for this turn, except this unit.

Skill1.Name: Rational Choice
Skill1.Comment: You get LP-1. and Rival gets LP-1.

FlavorText.Text1: Leave it to me, Ishtar.  I'll come up with a flawless plan.'
FlavorText.Text2: One of the strategists in whom the Silver Sun Emperor places a high degree of confidence.  At age 20, he's quite young for a Solar Kingdom strategist, but it was he who drafted the plans for recruiting Psycho Soldiers, and for developing Magic Dolls within Folrart.  He and Ishtar are both from an orphanage, and he chose the path of strategist so he could support her and her reckless fighting style.  He's currently in charge of a master plan to drag Durendal out onto the battlefield.

Soul.Name: Will of Destruction
Soul.Comment: Two random enemies get MAX HP-40.

Skill0.Name: True Eye
Skill0.Comment: Two random units get AGI-3 for this turn, except this unit.

Skill1.Name: Shaping Sentiment
Skill1.Comment: Target unit with AGI 1 or lower has it's LV, AT, DF, AGI, and RNG restored to their base values.

Skill2.Name: Conception of Ruin
Skill2.Comment: A random non-[subtype: Undead] enemy with AGI 1 or lower has it's MAXHP reduced by 50.

FlavorText.Text1: I suppose I won't have much time left to enjoy tea this way...  We will be sure to rebuild, under the protection of the Silver Sun Emperor.'
FlavorText.Text2: The princess royal of Spicurl Kingdom, one of the numerous small nations on the verge of destruction because of the Cursed Legions. For some reason, they are focusing their attacks on her Kingdom specifically, so she asked the Solar Kingdom for protection. She's had a curse called the True Eye her entire life, that lets her manipulate the emotions of living things, but she only finds it to be a source of annoyance.  She's royalty, but her phobias lead her to avoid strangers.

Attack.Name: Attack
Attack.Comment: Subtract AT directly from the HP of a random enemy unit within range.

Soul.Name: Damnation to the Fallen
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 50] to two random enemy units.

Skill0.Name: Overwhelming Strength
Skill0.Comment: When this unit executes an Attack, subtract this unit's AT from the HP of a random enemy in range.

Skill1.Name: Lord Armor
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/DF 30 or lower] This unit gets AT+10 and DF+5.

Skill2.Name: Mistaleu's Might
Skill2.Comment: Do [pierce damage: AT] to target enemy in range. Do [damage: AT] to a random enemy in range (this effect occurs 4 times).

FlavorText.Text1: Enemy of humanity!  Meet your doom in the face of my Armor of Lords!'
FlavorText.Text2: A warrior said to live in the small nation of Mistaleu.  He joins the Solar Kingdom forces in challenging the Cursed Legions to a showdown.  He clads himself in equipment called Lord Armor, which controls famous and cursed swords, and it has wandered the battlefield since the time of legend.  He eradicates his enemies with attack power that is legendary in its own right.

Skill0.Name: Alliance Treaty
Skill0.Comment: Both Iczers get SP = 2

FlavorText.Text1: The aid provided by the Solar Kingdom to the world invigorated and gave hope to other nations.'
FlavorText.Text2: A treaty of alliance formed between a Solar Kingdom government official, and the king of a small neighboring kingdom.  Under Folrart's national policy, it provided aid to the kingdom, which had been impoverished by its conflict with the Cursed Legions.  However, it's said that behind the scenes occurred such ugly deeds as squabbles over concessions.

Soul.Name: Fruits of Awareness
Soul.Comment: Two friendlies get [AT+ your SP x 10].

Skill0.Name: Chi Flow
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets AT + [your SP X5] for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Double Attack
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT 50%] to 2 random enemies in range.

FlavorText.Text1: Living husks who destroy the world!  You will receive the judgment of our Solar Kingdom!'
FlavorText.Text2: One of the Psycho Soldiers, on whom the Solar Kingdom has been focused in recent years.  She uses her ability to control a strange power that humans themselves possess, rather than divine miracle, to manipulate swords at will.  She departs for the front as part of Kyle's plan to subdue Durendal.

Soul.Name: Vanguard
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to all enemies. All friendlies get AGI+1 for this turn.

Skill0.Name: Scar of Devotion
Skill0.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 20] to target enemy.

Skill1.Name: Charge
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: ATX2] to a random enemy in range.  Do [damage: 50% of MAX HP] to this unit.

FlavorText.Text1: So that we might achieve true peace on Lavato!'
FlavorText.Text2: A member of the all-women Shrine Knights, one of the Solar Kingdom's three major bands of knights.  Its current commander is Ishtar.  In order for her to boost the fighting strength of the forces she leads, she formed a unit called Ishtar's Shrine Knights, under her direct control like the Knights of the 1st Shrine.

Soul.Name: Snake's Courage
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: Refess LV X20] to target unit.

Skill0.Name: Warrior's Tenacity
Skill0.Comment: Target, engaged enemy that is in range gets MAX HP-30.

Skill1.Name: Leap Strike
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to target enemy. If that unit is engaged, do an additional [damage: AT X2] to it.

FlavorText.Text1: When it comes to tenacity and envy, I doubt anyone holds a candle to the women warriors of the Leleua tribe.' - General Danes, on the Barbarians
FlavorText.Text2: A female warrior of Leleua, one of the Barbarian tribes.  Her agile spear attacks and natural armor made up of hard scales are sure to mean a tough fight for any normal human soldier.  She's an elite hunter, and it's rumored that once she targets something, she's sure to get it before she comes home.

Skill0.Name: Devotion
Skill0.Comment: Two target friendlies get MAXHP+10 and are healed 30HP.

FlavorText.Text1: The saints' prayers for world peace gave strength to those fighting the hollow Cursed Legions.'
FlavorText.Text2: The prayer of a lady knight who's been exalted as a holy woman.  The divine power that responds to her beautiful heart blesses her comrades.

Soul.Name: A Prayer for Peace
Soul.Comment: You get SP+2.

Skill0.Name: Selfless Sacrifice
Skill0.Comment: You get SP+2. This unit gets HP=0.

FlavorText.Text1: If it's for the sake of peace...my life is expendable!'
FlavorText.Text2: A female priest of the True God Church.  She has a devoted personality, and tries to help her allies by sacrificing herself.

Soul.Name: Golden Spear
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 40] to target enemy. Incease your Refess LV by 1.

Skill0.Name: Unified Strike
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT+# of friendly subtype: Knights X20] to a random enemy in range.

Skill1.Name: Blessing of the Church
Skill1.Comment: All friendly [subtype: Solar Kingdom] units get AT+5 and can't be affected by other cards' send to cemetery effects until the end of next turn.

FlavorText.Text1: Give great praise to the forces of the Solar Kingdom, as they march forth!  They do so in support of this world!'
FlavorText.Text2: Knights under the jurisdiction of the True God Church.  Taking part in the ceremony to bestow divine protection on the Solar Kingdom's forces, they added considerable animation to the festivities surrounding the departure for the front.

Soul.Name: Toughen
Soul.Comment: All units get MAX HP+10.

Skill0.Name: Tracking them Down
Skill0.Comment: One random enemy with AGI 4 or higher gets AGI-2.

Skill1.Name: Man's Best Friend
Skill1.Comment: The LV3 or lower friendly directly behind this unit gets AT+10. Then, this unit is healed 10HP.

FlavorText.Text1: Our enemy is the enemy of all living things.  Is it so strange that they would take part, too?'
FlavorText.Text2: One of Kyle's 'team of two' plans.  The idea behind the plans is that two people can accomplish things one alone cannot.  In this case, the goal is increase one's ability to search for and pursue enemies by teaming up with a dog.

Skill0.Name: Swift Occupation
Skill0.Comment: All enemies get AT-20 for this turn. All friendlies get AT+20 for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: Your barbarism ends here, undead!  Go back to the world of the dead, where you belong.'
FlavorText.Text2: The plan Kyle devised against the Cursed Legions was a bold one that targeted Durendal directly.  The Solar Kingdom forces therefore sought the cooperation of all nations, and launched a large-scale aggressive campaign.

Soul.Name: Entertain Me
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 60] to two random enemies. Send two random cards from your file to the cemetery.

Skill0.Name: True Immortality
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/this units's HP is 30 or lower] Send a random card to the cemetery from your file. Then, this unit gets 60MAXHP, is fully healed and gets AT+10.

Skill1.Name: Infinite Dance
Skill1.Comment: Send one random card to the cemetery from your file. Then, do [damage: AT] to two random enemies and send all copies of [True Immortal / Durendal] from your cemetery to your file.

FlavorText.Text1: Let us enjoy this magnificent game...  Right, sun god?'
FlavorText.Text2: A fiend calling himself the 'True Immortal'.  After the War of the Sun and Moon ended, he began using undead as his pawns in indiscriminate attacks all over Lavato.  His goal is not world conquest or the eradication of humanity, but to engineer events that will keep him from growing bored.  To contend with the strength of the forces of humanity, led by the Solar Kingdom, he's groping for a new pawn to prepare for battle.

Soul.Name: Uncontrolled Rage
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 30] to one enemy. Increase Rival's SP by 3.

Skill0.Name: Commander of Destruction
Skill0.Comment: A random enemy that is LV 4 or lower gets HP=0

Skill1.Name: Weak! Fragile! Pathetic!
Skill1.Comment: Target enemy that is LV 4 or lower gets HP=0

FlavorText.Text1: Ehyah hyah hyah!  Conflict!  Strife!  War!  That's all I'll ever want!  Now, how much will this battle jolt my heart!?'
FlavorText.Text2: One of the high-ranking dead spirits, calling themselves the Seven Captains, in the land of the undead.  The high-ranking spirits generally don't come out in the open much, but she will stand and fight right on the front lines.  Fueled by the bitterness and regret of a small nation's worth of people, aside from the times when her primary, docile personality emerges, she becomes a being who knows nothing but cruelty and violence.

Soul.Name: Price of Power
Soul.Comment: Set target friendly HP=0. Then, all friendlies get AT+20 and AGI+2.

Skill0.Name: Transmission
Skill0.Comment: Target unit gets AT+20, AGI+4, and is poisoned until the end of this turn.

Skill1.Name: Contamination
Skill1.Comment: Set a random friendly that is poisoned and with AGI 5 or higher to HP=0.

Skill2.Name: Lethal Contagion
Skill2.Comment: Set target enemy that is poisoned and has AGI 5 or higher to HP=0.

FlavorText.Text1: This is a pain.  Balheart, let's speed this fight up a little.'
FlavorText.Text2: A member of the Leleua Barbarian tribe.  He's the chief of staff of a group that was dispatched to help with the war the Solar Kingdom forces started against the Cursed Legions. But, his personality is self-centered, and all he thinks about is accomplishing his own goals. He's quietly hatching a scheme to make sure this world overflows with even more conflict.

Soul.Name: Fate's Hand
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to one random disengaged enemy. Revive target, closed friendly.

Skill0.Name: Requiem's Reanimation
Skill0.Comment: Target friendly [subtype: Undead] is fully healed, except this unit.

Skill1.Name: Covenant
Skill1.Comment: All friendly [subtype: Undead] cannot be affected or selected by other card's effects that include MAX HP change until the end of this turn, except this unit.

Skill2.Name: Exanimate Blast
Skill2.Comment: Select a friendly [subtype: Undead]. Do [damage: AT+selected unit's HP] to a random enemy in range.

FlavorText.Text1: I'm certain of it...  That day saw the advent of a god...'
FlavorText.Text2: A lich queen called 'she who travels the wheel of life', in the land of the undead where the dead are said to dwell.  Originally she lived in high social standing in the Far East, but her family was ruined due to a curse placed upon her.  In truth, she was a girl possessed by a warped god who sought death, and she became an undead in return for fulfilling the god's desire for 'death'.

Skill0.Name: Feast of the Dead
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/Lawtia 3 or higher] Send target open or closed friendly to the cemetery. Then, send target closed, enemy of LV4 or lower to the cemetery.

FlavorText.Text1: The dead swarm went on as far as the eye could see.  It might have gone on forever, yet people began to resist them.'
FlavorText.Text2: The dead army, led by Durendal.  Their indiscriminate attacks, and overwhelming numbers and productivity cast the people of every nation into despair.  However, the man called the King of Mankind never gave up.

IczerAttack.Name: Iczer Attack
IczerAttack.Comment: When this unit uses Iczer attack, it costs 0 SP, has [conditional use/battletime night]

Soul.Name: Indescribable Terror
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 20] to two random enemies. Target friendly gets AT+20 for this turn.

Skill0.Name: Stage 1: Soul Depletion
Skill0.Comment: When this unit uses Iczer attack, it costs 0 SP, has [conditional use/battletime night]

Skill1.Name: Stage 2: Breath of Flies
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/battletime night] Do [pierce damage: 20] to two random enemies in range. This unit gets AT+20 for this turn.

Skill2.Name: Stage 3: Undying Hunger
Skill2.Comment: [conditional use/battletime night] This unit is fully healed.

FlavorText.Text1: He killed everyone.  His wife, his kids Yuh and Lyra, everyone.  That's when I saw it.  There he was, full of flies.'
FlavorText.Text2: A dreaded lycanthropy disease, the onset of which signals death.  This strain is slow-moving, rotting the inside of the body as it gradually takes it over.  Perhaps because of the rot, those afflicted often spew out large quantities of flies.  Victims gradually go mad, so that they find themselves in the grip of fear and despair by the time they die.

Soul.Name: Balanced Exchange
Soul.Comment: Send a friendly  directly to the Cemetery. Then, send a disengaged, enemy directly to the Cemetery.

Skill0.Name: Purification
Skill0.Comment: Remove up to 5 cards in Rival's cemetery from the game. Then, all friendlies are immune to other cards' effects that include engaging until the end of this turn.

Skill1.Name: Cast Out
Skill1.Comment: Subtract 60 from the MAXHP of target enemy in range.

FlavorText.Text1: It's just a hollow spirit, after all.  That makes it something of a child, to the exorcists.'
FlavorText.Text2: The Duchy of Crest has fought many battles against undead hosts, and it has pursued anti-undead military preparations that differ from those of the Solar Kingdom.  The most distinctive of these is the training of skilled exorcists.  Their techniques have the overwhelming power to send undead back to the world of the dead, and this became a big reason why Crest proved difficult to assault, despite its arms reduction.

Soul.Name: Triggered Alarm
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to all enemies. All friendlies get DF+5.

Skill0.Name: Shield Synthesis
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets DF +[Rival's SP X10] for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Lancer
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to a column of enemies in range.

FlavorText.Text1: Intruder detected within guarded area.  Initiating shift from guard mode to repellence mode.'
FlavorText.Text2: The latest model of Magic Doll, developed by the newly formed Alchemist Guild within the Duchy of Crest.  The single absolute creator, Sumer, has gone missing, but her research was not lost, and the alchemists used it as a basis to begin developing Magic Dolls.  This Knight Model is considered their first masterpiece.  Unlike previous Magic Dolls, models made with versatility in mind performed well in combat against the undead.

Skill0.Name: Stab in the Dark
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: number cards in rival's cemetery X 5] to a random enemy. If that unit's HP is -20 or below, Rival gets LP-1.

FlavorText.Text1: A carpenter's job is to make houses.  A cook's job is to make meals.  An assassin's job is to make sorrow.'
FlavorText.Text2: An assassination carried out in the dead of night.  Though the times shifted from peace to ruinous war, there was always work for assassins.

Soul.Name: Raging Spear
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to all units.

Skill0.Name: Black Knight's Blow
Skill0.Comment: Do [pierce damage: AT] to target column of enemies in range.

Skill1.Name: Enemy Reinforcements
Skill1.Comment: Return one random card from Rival's cemetery to the file.

FlavorText.Text1: Think of a blow from Crest's forces as one big lance!  One blow goes through every foe!'
FlavorText.Text2: Members of the Duchy of Crest's cavalry, their jet black armor has earned them the name Black Knights.  In an effort to strengthen Crest's forces, their current general, Yug, focused on boosting cavalry skills.  The result was the perfection of mounted combat techniques that were feared for years to come.

Soul.Name: Shadow Invasion
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 40] to target enemy. Incease your Lawtia LV by 1.

Skill0.Name: Cursed Existence
Skill0.Comment: The unit directly behind this unit gets AT-10. If that unit has AT1 or higher, this unit is healed 50HP.

FlavorText.Text1: Why do you conclude our opponents are unarmed, when you know they're sorcerers?  They're not like you and me.'
FlavorText.Text2: Warriors of shadow produced by users of shadow magic, a type of sorcery.  Their ability to keep acting so long as magic power remains makes them deeply frightening to human warriors.

Soul.Name: Liriellia's Curse
Soul.Comment: Send target, closed unit that is LV 2 or lower directly to the cemetery. Rival gets SP-1

Skill0.Name: Unworthy Burial
Skill0.Comment: Send one closed LV1 unit to the cemetery. Then, you cannot set any LV 1 unit card next turn.

FlavorText.Text1: I don't really like animal ghosts, you know?  But this kind of thing's all Liri likes to have at her disposal.' - Yudit, chatting with a shaman
FlavorText.Text2: A low-level ghost inhabiting an animal's corpse.  They're suited to indiscriminate attacks and assaults, and Liriella likes to release them on the battlefield.  But when the undead hawks took to the sky, Psycho Soldiers and Wizard Kingdom forces were up there waiting.

Skill0.Name: Destroyed Tome
Skill0.Comment: Send a random Grimoire from Rival's File to the cemetery. Rival gets SP - [LV of selected Grimoire].

FlavorText.Text1: Wisdom is destroyed by ignorance.  I'd call that irony.  How about you?'
FlavorText.Text2: The war between humanity and the Cursed Legions wrought destruction on all cultures.   Included in this were many precious books even the Wizard Kingdom couldn't preserve, so this conflict resulted in many aspects of art and technology that fell behind.

Soul.Name: Call to War
Soul.Comment: Remove 10 cards in your cemetery from the game. Then, do [damage: 40] to 2 random enemies.

Skill0.Name: Roar of Leleua
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: # of cards in Rival's cemetery X5] to two random enemies. Remove 5 cards in Rival's cemetery from the game.

Skill1.Name: Harnessing Power
Skill1.Comment: This unit gets HP and AT +[# of Gowen grimoires in your File X10] for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: Battle is beautiful because it's waged between the living.  You defile such battle, and I condemn you on behalf of all living beings!'
FlavorText.Text2: The head of Leleua, one of the tribes of the barbarian tribal state in the south.  He abandoned fighting in the south to join in the war the Solar Kingdom started against the Cursed Legions.  His military prowess is said to exceed even that of the great General Zagar.  He's a soldier who respects decorum, but fighting humans is his supreme joy, and he's thinking of resuming his southern conflict with the Mercenary Kingdom once the Cursed Legions have been defeated.

Soul.Name: Sword's Burial
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: # of cards in your Cemetery X5] to 2 disengaged, random enemies.

Skill0.Name: Blade Force
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT+ your Gowen X5] to target enemy in range. If that unit has HP0 or lower, increase your Gowen by 1.

Skill1.Name: Inheritance of Light
Skill1.Comment: Two friendlies heal HP +[your Gowen X5], except this unit.

FlavorText.Text1: This is the world they threw everything away to protect.  If they're trying to destroy it, I will of course again take up the sword.'
FlavorText.Text2: After the War of the Sun and Moon, Fierte rounded up children who'd lost their parents in the war, and opened an orphanage.  Constance is a woman she trusts.  The children call her 'the nice lady', as if contrasting her with Fierte.  When the conflict with the Cursed Legions intensified, and the area around the orphanage was no longer safe, she seemed to abandon her kindness and left for the battlefield with a sharp look in her eyes.

Soul.Name: Massive Impact
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 50] to target enemy.

Skill0.Name: Reckless Embattlement
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets AT+[your Gowen X5] and AGI+[your Gowen] for this turn. Reduce your Gowen by 1.

Skill1.Name: Second Impact
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT 50%] to 2 random enemies in range. This unit's AT and AGI become permanent.

FlavorText.Text1: The head of the Leleua tribe is, likewise, well aware that our main dish awaits us after this!'
FlavorText.Text2: A warrior from the Harmonia Barbarian tribe.  A fighting style of laying waste to the enemy from the vanguard is heroic and intense, even amongst Barbarians.  However, his approach to battle is completely different, and his calm and cautious personality has produced tactics that have brought about victory for the Barbarians on every battlefield.  Like Balheart, he espouses policy when it comes to battle, and he's joined in this war to destroy the Cursed Legions for defiling such policies.

Soul.Name: Fundamental Heat
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to one disengaged enemy. Then, send 2 Grimoires from Rival's File to the Cemetery.

Skill0.Name: Summon Wildfire
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: 30] to one random enemy in area[1-2-3], area [4-5-6] and area [7-8-9]. The units struck begin burning.

Skill1.Name: Tracking Blaze
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: your Gowen X5] to target enemy in range.

FlavorText.Text1: Dead bodies attacking us people.  I don't like the sound of that.  Well, I'm not just gonna let it happen!'
FlavorText.Text2: An adventurer and spirit wielder who wanders the world.  She has an extremely willful personality, and there are dreadful anecdotes about her in various locales.  It's even said some places have put bounties on her head.  She's an extraordinary spirit wielder, as she can employ spirits of fire, water, wind, and wood, allowing her to wield special spells using combinations of their powers.

Skill0.Name: Cataclysm
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: your SP X10] to all units. You get SP=0.

FlavorText.Text1: In the end, there's nothing we can do, if the earth grows angry.'
FlavorText.Text2: An incantation that makes the powers of spirits rampage, causing natural disasters like earthquakes and tornadoes.  Not much magic power is needed to borrow the spirits' powers, but the employed spirits will continue to rampage until the caster's magic power is all gone.

Soul.Name: Enact Contract
Soul.Comment: Send a friendly directly to the Cemetery. Then, send a disengaged, enemy directly to the Cemetery.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 5 or higher, this unit gets HP +10, AT +10.

Skill0.Name: Slow Descent
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/focused] Do [damage: AT] to target enemy of RNG 2 or higher.

Skill1.Name: Punishment of Heaven
Skill1.Comment: This unit is focused until the end of next turn. Do [damage: AT] to target enemy in range. If that unit has AT50 or higher, Do an additional [damage: AT].

FlavorText.Text1: Money is the key that opens all doors, including the door to hell.'
FlavorText.Text2: One of the assassins active in the Far East.  Over there, skirmish-like conflicts have been going on for so long, everyone learns some kind of fighting technique.  Some of them are willing to perform assassinations for very low fees.  It's said they never work alone, but in groups, so they'll be sure to send their target to hell.

Soul.Name: Rampaging Cattle
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to target enemy. Target friendly cannot be hit by an Attack action until the end of next turn.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 5 or higher, this unit gets HP +30, AT +10.

Skill0.Name: Impulsive Destruction
Skill0.Comment: All units get AT+20 for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: So, you really are the muscle-bound idiot you appear to be?' -a middle-aged soldier who was killed while drinking
FlavorText.Text2: A member of the Harmonia Barbarian tribe.  The destructive power generated by the muscles in his huge body make him a desirable warrior.  A characteristic of Harmonia is that its members are often gentle most of the time, and, no exception to that rule, he has a gentle personality.  But hurt his feelings, and he's liable to beat you to death for it.

Soul.Name: Flare Blitz
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to target enemy. All enemies begin burning.

Skill0.Name: Born in Flame
Skill0.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 10] to a random enemy. That unit begins burning.

Skill1.Name: Arcane Ember
Skill1.Comment: Subtract 20HP from two random, burning enemies.

FlavorText.Text1: If it was spawned by magic, doesn't that mean it's not alive? ...Then it's impressively built, considering.'
FlavorText.Text2: A magic creature that can be spotted on rare occasions in volcanic regions. Created by magic, they now live in the wild on a certain mountain range filled with magical radiation.  It is territorial, and will spit flames to drive away trespassers. The flames of the Terrestrial Salamander depend on the magic power stored up inside its body; a fully-fed salamander's flame rivals the breath of a fire dragon.

Skill0.Name: Wild
Skill0.Comment: All friendlies are Focused until the end of next turn. Target friendly gets AGI+1 for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: Well isn't that interesting... That there's magic that can make folks run wild like that.'
FlavorText.Text2: An incantation that temporarily turns people into bestial subhumans.  The type of subhuman one turns into varies depending on the individual.  The prevailing view as to why its invocation is unstable is that the magic substance contained in subhuman blood, which is necessary as an intermediary for the incantation, affects different humans in different ways.  However, the details remain unclear.  This incantation holds many mysteries.

Attack.Name: Attack
Attack.Comment: When this unit executes an Attack, do [damage: AT] to one random enemy of LV 3 or higher in range.

Soul.Name: Bullet Time
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 40] to target enemy. Increase your Gowen LV by 1.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 4 or higher, this unit gets AT +10.

Skill0.Name: Large Bounties Only
Skill0.Comment: When this unit executes an Attack, do [damage: AT] to a random enemy of LV 3 or higher in range.

Skill1.Name: Rapid Reload
Skill1.Comment: One friendly [subtype: Gunner] gets AT+10 for this turn and is disengaged, except [Card: Wandering Gunslinger].

FlavorText.Text1: One shot, one kill.  Quick and accurate.  That's my motto.'
FlavorText.Text2: A mercenary who uses guns, which are starting to become the weapons of choice on the Grand Surface.  As it's hardly been a century since guns came into being, all manner of techniques have been researched.  The quick draw, the art of handling a gun quickly, has in particular undergone refinement, and is credited with launching any number of schools of technique.

Soul.Name: Bow Malfunctions
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 10] to 1 random unit.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 5 or higher, this unit gets HP +10, AT +10.

Skill0.Name: Increase Power
Skill0.Comment: One friendly unit gets LV+1.

Skill1.Name: Deadly Bow
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: LV X10] to target enemy in range. This unit gets LV-1.

FlavorText.Text1: Ehahah!  You'd best not underestimate our Far East technology.'
FlavorText.Text2: A mech soldier, developed in utmost secrecy by Nabari, a heroic land in the Far East.  It was also known by the alias 'automaton soldier', and it had fighting strength on par with other mech soldiers.  There were various types of Eastern Gear Assassins, and as they looked identical to dolls, they were often used for assassinations.

Soul.Name: Tricks of the Dual Swordsman
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 40] to target enemy. Target friendly [subtype: Warrior] gets AT+20 and AGI+2 for this turn.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 5 or higher, this unit gets HP +10, AGI +1.

Skill0.Name: Audacious Swing
Skill0.Comment: Do [pierce damage: AT+10] to 2 random enemies in range. Then, do [damage: 25% of MAXHP] to this unit.

FlavorText.Text1: It's nice to fight sometimes without thinking about advantage and disadvantage, isn't it?'
FlavorText.Text2: One of the mercenaries who appeared to fight the Cursed Legions.  He's a swordsman who wields two long swords, and he questioned the decisions of the Mercenary Kingdom, which for some reason has adopted a wait-and-see approach.

Skill0.Name: Mischievous Prank
Skill0.Comment: All units are Immune to other cards' effects that include engaging until the end of this turn. All enemies have their AGI set randomly to [0->5] and get DF=0 for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: Huh?  You fell down suddenly?  Faeries were the ones behind that.'
FlavorText.Text2: A prank played on a traveler by young faeries.  When faeries play pranks, they first cast a spell that keeps people from seeing them, which is rather ill-natured of them.

Soul.Name: Paladin's Reinforcements
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 60] to a random, disengaged enemy. Do [damage: 20] to target enemy.

Skill0.Name: Chaotic Offense
Skill0.Comment: All friendly non-characters get AT+10 and RNG+1 for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Lightning
Skill1.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 20] to 2 random enemies. This unit is focused until the end of next turn.

Skill2.Name: Discharge
Skill2.Comment: [conditional use/focused] Do [pierce damage: 60] to 2 random enemies.

FlavorText.Text1: Nowww then, might as well get serious.  Let's do this!'
FlavorText.Text2: One of the paladins of the reborn Wizard Kingdom.  He's always such a hot-blooded, spirited man, he's a bit out of place in a kingdom where so many possess calm personalities.  He uses spells that electrify his own body, and specializes in launching aggressive attacks against his enemies.  When the paladins prepared to join the fight against the Cursed Legions, he was the first one to go rushing off to the battlefield.

Soul.Name: Rat Hunting
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 30] to target enemy. This effect is repeated a total of twice.

Skill0.Name: Elusive
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/this units's HP is 30 or lower] This unit gets AGI=5 and cannot be hit by Attack actions for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Twin Fang
Skill1.Comment: Engage target enemy in range. Then, do [pierce damage: AT] to a random, disengaged enemy in range.

Skill2.Name: Kenjutsu
Skill2.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to 1 random enemy in Area[1-4-7], Area[2-5-8] and Area[3-6-9].

FlavorText.Text1: 'Wow, you're stalking cute, strong, lil' ol' me...  You've got good taste!'
FlavorText.Text2: A wizard soldier and Ibert's student. Her fighting style is a combination of her innate magic, expensive magic gems, and her use of Ibert's Celerity sword-draw technique.  She's overbearing, but because she always calls things as she sees them, she's still very popular. She had never lost to anyone but Ibert, until being defeated by a mysterious swordsman who she is now trying to track down. Her hobby is collecting small cute things - currently cat-themed accessories.

Soul.Name: Force Conversion
Soul.Comment: Target disengaged enemy is engaged until the end of next turn. Do [damage: 20] to target enemy.

Skill0.Name: Innocuous Potion
Skill0.Comment: Poison 2 units until the end of next turn.

Skill1.Name: Substantial Reaction
Skill1.Comment: All Poisoned units get MAX HP-10 and AGI-1 for this turn, except this unit.

Skill2.Name: Pharmaceutical Drugs
Skill2.Comment: Poison target unit for 3 turns. Then, any target poisoned unit is healed 40HP.

FlavorText.Text1: THIS time it's flawless!'
FlavorText.Text2: One of the Wizard Kingdom alchemists. She herself has no evil intent, but every chemical she makes has unexpected side effects, making her infamous as the Wizard Kingdom's unluckiest genius.  This bothers her, so her current production challenge is to come up with a chemical that won't have any abnormal effects when used on one's body.

Attack.Name: Attack
Attack.Comment: When this unit uses an Attack action, do [damage: AGI X10] to one random enemy unit in range. If that unit is at HP0 or below, this unit gets AGI+1.

Soul.Name: Karsteela's Intervention
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to a enemy unit. Move enemies from [area: 1-2-3] to [area: 7-8-9], and from [area: 7-8-9] to [area: 1-2-3].

Skill0.Name: Spear's Emboldening
Skill0.Comment: When this unit uses an Attack, do [damage: AGI X10] to a random enemy in range. If that unit has HP0 or lower, this unit gets AGI+1.

Skill1.Name: Unreliable Mentor
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/AGI5 or higher] This unit gets AGI=1 and is fully healed.

FlavorText.Text1: I'd just like to hurry and cancel my contract with this obnoxious spear.'
FlavorText.Text2: The contract partner of the intelligent and willful cursed spear, Karsteela.  With a single cry, it will come flying from across the world, stabbing right through any being with magic power to which it reacts.  She's also a bounty hunter, famously known in the region around the Wizard Kingdom by the alias the Flash of Death.  She has a cheerful, frank personality, but the spear itself is stubborn and malicious.

Skill0.Name: Aqua Armor
Skill0.Comment: Target friendly gets AGI+1. All friendlies get AGI+1 and get DF= [DF+AGI x5] for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: This armor has overwhelming strength, and wonderful flexibility.'
FlavorText.Text2: Sorcery that produces magic armor from water.  The fixed water repels enemy blades using magic power, but as it's water, it's nearly weightless, and as the wearer can move around easily, it's often used by wizard soldiers.

Soul.Name: Anger Management
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] and engage a row of enemies.

Skill0.Name: Two-Headed Strike
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to 2 random enemies in range.

Skill1.Name: Pact Between Tribes
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/1 or more friendly [subtype: Barbarian] that are not mono-Falkow are on the field.] This unit gets AT+10.

FlavorText.Text1: Everything about them's doubled.  Speaking voices, how much they eat, cruelty, laughter...  But sadly, their intelligence is only normal.'
FlavorText.Text2: A member of the Leleua Barbarian tribe. Even for their tribe, they're a race that lives on the frontier and doesn't have much contact with the outside world.  Their scale armor and innate battle sense, characteristic of Leleua, mean they're accepted as excellent soldiers among the Barbarians, but the level of thinking power having two heads brings with it is a special point.  However, as this doesn't mean their intelligence is doubled, it doesn't exactly mean they're smart.

Soul.Name: Fist of Magic
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 30] to two random enemies. This counts as 2 Grimoire activations.

Skill0.Name: Channeling Mana
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets AT +[# of grimoires in your File X10] for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Double Attack
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT 50%] to 2 random enemies in range.

FlavorText.Text1: Oh, you're gonna run for it?  With that leg?  Yeah, I don't think you'll make it.'
FlavorText.Text2: A martial artist born with innate magic qualities peculiar to the Wizard Kingdom.  She doesn't serve the kingdom, but makes her living as a guard, protecting a town from attacks by pirates and such.  She can't manipulate magic, since she was never taught how, but she can exhibit tremendous physical movements by bringing the magical essence in the air into her body.

Soul.Name: Ascend to the Sky
Soul.Comment: Target friendly gets AT+50 and cannot be hit by Attack actions until the end of this turn.

Skill0.Name: Thunder
Skill0.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 20] to2 random enemies.

Skill1.Name: Flying Attack
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to target enemy.

FlavorText.Text1: The Wizard Kingdom are rulers of the seas and skies.  The symbol of their mastery of the skies is the Sorcerer Sky Knight.'
FlavorText.Text2: When the Wizard Kingdom was reestablished, its knight groups were also restructured.  Instead of horses, the kingdom's Sky Knights ride giant birds and rain lightning imparted by the Thunder Paladin down from the sky, annihilating their opponents on the ground without ever giving them a chance to attack.  They truly are the rulers of the skies.

Skill0.Name: It's you!
Skill0.Comment: Engage target enemy that is LV 4 or higher until the end of next turn.

Skill1.Name: Or not...
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/'It's you!' failed] Target friendly gets AGI+1 and is disengaged. You get SP+1.

FlavorText.Text1: I knew who the criminal was...no, I knew what the trick was, from the start.  I didn't know who could pull off that trick, though...  But, you just told me.'
FlavorText.Text2: The inference methods of Daniel, the Wizard Kingdom's greatest detective, are simple, but they're difficult for other people to understand.  It's just him munching on his favorite chocolate, and that's it.  However, doing this shows Daniel the scene of the murder as it happened.

Soul.Name: Wealth Redistribution
Soul.Comment: You get SP+3. Rival gets SP+1.

Skill0.Name: Here for the Booty
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/your SP is 3 or higher] This unit gets AT=50

Skill1.Name: Charge
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: ATX2] to a random enemy in range.  Do [damage: 50% of MAX HP] to this unit.

FlavorText.Text1: These gun weapons give you certain advantages in sea combat.  Like...bludgeoning, for example.'
FlavorText.Text2: Pirates who ravage the seas around the Wizard Kingdom.  There've been many pirates around since the War of the Sun and Moon, but their privateering activities have not ceased in the twenty years since, must to the consternation of the kingdom's leaders.  The way the pirates usually operate is to start shooting as soon as they approach a merchant ship, fight off the escorts before they can get close, then grapple to the merchant ship with ease and steal its cargo.

Soul.Name: Wishful Fate
Soul.Comment: Move a random enemy to a random open spot and engage it. You get SP+1.

Skill0.Name: Prediction
Skill0.Comment: Return one unit of HP0 or lower to its Card File. If the unit is friendly, you get SP+[unit's base LV] +1.

Skill1.Name: Fickle Future
Skill1.Comment: Return this unit to it's File. You get SP+1.

FlavorText.Text1: Mhmhm...  Shall I tell you your fortune?'
FlavorText.Text2: A fortuneteller within the Wizard Kingdom.  In the reborn kingdom, research is progressing on the principle of causality, which concerns the fate of people, and how to alter said fate.  This research was originally being performed by Black Cat  Fellana, but once she disappeared after the War of the Sun and Moon, independent research began based on the research tomes she left behind.  It's currently in vogue in the Wizard Kingdom, as a form of fortunetelling.

Soul.Name: Mechanical Blade
Soul.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 40] to target enemy. Increase your Falkow LV by 1.

Skill0.Name: Field Repairs
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets DF=15, LV=3, and is healed 30HP.

Skill1.Name: Battery Reserves
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/this unit's LV is 3 or higher] This unit gets HP=10, DF=0, and LV-2.

FlavorText.Text1: The Mechanical Hermit Crab is the Wizard Kingdom's first patrol model mech soldier.  All the mech soldiers developed by the kingdom are modeled on animals, and are highly valued as 'steel animals'.'
FlavorText.Text2: A type of mech soldier based on a hermit crab motif that was developed by the Wizard Kingdom. Unlike the Mechanical Bat, which was built for reconnaissance, this Mechanical Hermit Crab handles guard duty and defense. It recognizes its target and wields iron claws to eliminate the threat as soon as it concludes there's danger.  As a domestic sentinel, they can be seen operating inside places like the royal castle.

Skill0.Name: Song of Miracles
Skill0.Comment: Rival Iczer gets SP+2 and one less SP at the beginning of next turn.

Skill1.Name: Chorus
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/Falkow LV3 or higher] All enemy units get DF=0 for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: That melody spread throughout the hearts of the war-weary troops.'
FlavorText.Text2: A tune master Wizard Kingdom musicians play on a harp.  There's magic power imbued in the music the musicians play, and even enemy soldiers are mesmerized enough to briefly forget about the battle.

Soul.Name: Dawn of Tragedy
Soul.Comment: Reduce the Sphere levels of both Iczers by 3.

Skill0.Name: First Victim
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/Lawtia LV 5 or lower] A random enemy that is LV3 or lower is sent directly to the Cemetery.

Skill1.Name: In the King's Name
Skill1.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 50] to target enemy in range. Decrease your LP by 1.

FlavorText.Text1: Oh, king.  My king...  Can you not yet appear for me?'
FlavorText.Text2: A ruthless killer, who's been committing indiscriminate murders all over Lavato.  Those lucky enough to survive describe only a terrifying experience, and this woman wearing a silver death mask has become a symbol of dread.  Apparently she has considerable fighting strength, and typical assassins stand little chance against her.  Who in the world is she?

Soul.Name: Fordya's Flash
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to 2 random enemies.

Skill0.Name: The Bow that Brings Light
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/Gowen LV1 or higher] Do [damage: 30] to all enemies in range. Reduce your Gowen LV by 1.

Skill1.Name: Glimmer of Shura
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/Refess LV2 or higher] Subtract AT directly from the MAX HP of target enemy in range. Reduce your Refess LV by 2.

FlavorText.Text1: ...A conflict like this needs stopping, and soon.  We're going to run out of time to eliminate those fools.'
FlavorText.Text2: An archer hero called the Shimmer of War, who was ranked beside Wings of Light in the Solar Kingdom.  After an incident in which a True God Church priest was assaulted, he left his group and is now a wandering mercenary.  The assaulted priest has sent numerous pursuers after him, but he's repelled them with ease while meeting up with heroes the world over, all in the pursuit of some goal.

Soul.Name: Realm of the Shadow
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to 2 random enemies. Rival gets SP-2.

Skill0.Name: Shadow's Mark
Skill0.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 40] to 2 random Marked enemies in range. Mark 2 target enemies of HP1 or higher.

Skill2.Name: Cover in Darkness
Skill2.Comment: Create 1 friendly [Token Card: Shadow Illusion] in target open area.

FlavorText.Text1: How optimistic, going against your predetermined destiny... But, maybe the outcome could be a little different?'
FlavorText.Text2: An archmage of the Wizard Kingdom. Several years ago she suddenly became prominent, publishing various magic essays and earning the label of genius. She's especially gifted in shadow magic, and her unique ability to control multiple shadow warriors at once is overwhelming.  However, her other-worldly speech, and tendency to avoid entanglements with others whenever possible, do give rise to a certain air of suspicion...

Soul.Name: Forced Imbalance
Soul.Comment: You get Refess LV+2 and Falkow LV+2. You may not set a Grimoire card next turn or the turn after.

Skill0.Name: Psychokinetic Storm
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to 1 enemy unit for every friendly [subtype: Psionic].

Skill1.Name: Share the Power
Skill1.Comment: All friendly [subtype: Psionic] units get LV+1 and AT+10 for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: I feel sorry for the girl...  But you know, we're in a position to give her a chance for a decent life.  Don't you agree, Balfrais?'
FlavorText.Text2: A test subject used by the True God Church researchers in the initial stages of the Solar Kingdom's new force, the Psycho Soldiers. Upon seeing her gruesome situation, Kyle rescued her. Perhaps because of her ordeal, she doesn't speak much or show much emotion.  However, it's said that lately she's begun to smile in front of those to whom she's close. She trusts Ishtar and Kyle, and insisted on going with them when they dispatched.

Soul.Name: Frozen Carapace
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 30] to a unit, give it AT-20 and render it engaged.

Skill0.Name: Winter is Coming
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/1 or fewer friendlies on the field] Do [pierce damage: 30] to 2 random enemies and engage them.

Skill1.Name: Devour Prey
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to 2 random enemies in range. This unit is healed 25% of it's MAX HP.

FlavorText.Text1: What kind of monster's on this mountain?  ...Wait, there it is!  What is that thing!?  It's huuuuuuge!'
FlavorText.Text2: A giant creature living in Lavato's icy mountains.  It's regarded as a large bear that underwent a peculiar evolution in order to survive in the harsh environment, but the truth is unknown.  It's so powerful in battle, it's often called a dragon.  It has on its large back an extremely hard, tough shell that repels all weapons, and usually it rests within that shell.  When it grows hungry, it rises up and ferociously attacks its prey.

Soul.Name: Safeguard the Small
Soul.Comment: All friendlies level 2 and below get MAX HP+10, AT+20, and fully recover HP.

Skill0.Name: Vibrant Energy
Skill0.Comment: Target friendly gets AT+10. All units get RNG+1 for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Elemental Surge
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT+10] to a random enemy in range. Then, return 1 [card: Elemental Burst] that was removed from the game to your card File and you get SP+1.

FlavorText.Text1: The world won't be at peace until we defeat the undead horde!'
FlavorText.Text2: A faerie who's proficient at controlling magic elements, even compared to her fellow faerie mages.  Durendal's attack on the entire world has brought harm upon even the faeries.

Attack.Name: Attack
Attack.Comment: Ocho poison attack.

Soul.Name: Haphazard Sludge
Soul.Comment: All units are Poisoned until the end of next turn.

Skill0.Name: Polluted Touch
Skill0.Comment: When this unit executes an Attack, any unit hit is Poisoned for 3 turns. This unit recovers HP when resting if Poisoned.

Skill1.Name: Born from Filth
Skill1.Comment: This unit is healed 10HP and gets AT+10 until the end of this turn for every poisoned unit on the field.

FlavorText.Text1: Swamp? Garbage dump? No, no, that's the feeding grounds of the Ochu.'
FlavorText.Text2: A gelatinous monster sometimes called the 'Ochu' by locals. It likes to live in sodden places like marshlands, and city sewer systems. It is attracted to anything that shines, and it attempts to take it all into itself using the tentacles growing from its body.

Soul.Name: Indiscriminate Blaze
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to target enemy. Remove 5 random cards from Rival's cemetery from the game. If at least 5 cards are removed, then send a random card from Rival's file to the cemetery.

Skill0.Name: Revenge
Skill0.Comment: Remove a random unit in your Cemetery from the game. Then, do [pierce damage: removed unit's AT] to a random enemy.

Skill1.Name: Touch of Revenge
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to a random Burning enemy in range. Unit gets MAX HP=current HP and stops Burning.

Skill2.Name: Carcass Rupture
Skill2.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 10] to 2 random enemies. Those units begin burning.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Those guys are incredible.  They might be dead bodies, but they run around like they're on fire.'
FlavorText.Text2: Durendal used his power to take the dead with a desire for vengeance that wandered the land of the undead, and resurrect them.  The flames engulfing their bodies are the physical embodiment of obsessions mistakenly held in death, so they never go out.  They no longer know who the target of their revenge is, so they try to burn away every living thing they can find.

Soul.Name: Reborn in Light
Soul.Comment: Two units get MAX HP=25, HP=25, DF=20, AT=10, and AGI=2.

Skill0.Name: Rain of Light
Skill0.Comment: You get SP+1.

Skill1.Name: Blasting Sunbeam
Skill1.Comment: One friendly unit of LV4 or higher gets AT+20 for this turn and is healed 10 HP, except this unit. Then, do [damage: AT] to a random enemy column in range.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Twisting a knife is all in the wrist. What? Is there a better way to mix chocolate?'
FlavorText.Text2: It is traditional for one of the Shrine Knight leaders to make chocolates each year. This year, Judie was elected. But maybe there's a reason she's never been asked to do anything domestic before...

Attack.Name: Attack
Attack.Comment: Mermaid Attack to work with Emana

Soul.Name: Leaving the Ocean
Soul.Comment: Set Rival Iczer's Falkow level to 0.

Skill0.Name: Sword of Tears
Skill0.Comment: Subtract AT+20 directly from the HP of target enemy unit in range.

Skill1.Name: Numbing Slash
Skill1.Comment: Engage one friendly disengaged [subtype: Mermaid]. Then, do [damage: AT] to a random row of enemies in range. All units hit of AGI 0 or lower get DF=0.

FlavorText.Text1: 'I'm not hungry anymore...'
FlavorText.Text2: The mermaid fighters took on human forms to join forces with Wizard Kingdom troops during the great war. To reinforce their alliance, Regus officers would try to make overtures of friendship to the mermaids, including taking them out... for the local favorite, sushi.

Soul.Name: Righteous Roar
Soul.Comment: Return 2 random [subtype: dragon kin] cards from your Cemetery to your File.

Skill0.Name: Lucent Descent
Skill0.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 10] to all units.

Skill1.Name: Meteorite
Skill1.Comment: Do [pierce damage: 20] to 3 random enemies in range. The units struck become 'Charged'.

Skill2.Name: Final Spark
Skill2.Comment: Do [pierce damage: AT] to target enemy in range. Reduce all 'Charged' enemies DF by 10 and do [damage: 60] to them. All Charged enemies are no longer Charged.

Skill3.Name: Shards of Luminance
Skill3.Comment: [conditional use/this units's HP is 50 or lower]  Reduce all 'Charged' enemies DF by 10 and do [damage: 30] to them. All units are no longer Charged.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Respect my king or face eradication.'
FlavorText.Text2: The one Bastandorra calls his 'most loyal knight.' He appeared from the darkness above Lavato's heavens to join his king. In battle, he charges his enemies with electrostatic power and detonates them with a strange white light. Regus scholars have observed him in action, but even they are not sure if he is a dragon or some kind of fantastical machine.

Soul.Name: Chick Foundling
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to 1 + [50% number of Grimoires used] random enemy units and give them DF=0. Set number of Grimoires used to 0.

Skill0.Name: Reborn from Ashes
Skill0.Comment: [Conditional use/level=5 or lower] This unit gets LV=6, MAX HP=90, AT=30, DF=0, RNG=4 and is fully healed.

Skill1.Name: Burning Wings
Skill1.Comment: [Conditional use/level=6 or higher] Do [damage: AT] to all enemies in range. This unit gets LV-1. Do [damage: 10] to all friendly [subtype: monster] units, except this unit.

FlavorText.Text1: During the 2013 Kickstarter, Pete contributed his take on the card 'Phoenix Chick.' www.sluggy.com
FlavorText.Text2: Pete is the pioneer and creator behind Sluggy Freelance, the longest running daily webcomic. You might notice his art is not a small bird. That's because among other things, his comic is known for the occasional pun. Oasis, Sluggy Freelance and its characters are copyright Pete Abrams, all rights reserved.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Empires have rison and fallen, all because of this golden metal.'
FlavorText.Text2: Granium is a golden-colored metal prized for its ability to retain its appearance and shape despite exposure to the elements. It has been used in jewelry and as currency in Lavato since before recorded history.

FlavorText.Text1: 'The beauty of the moon can be held in your hand.'
FlavorText.Text2: Named for its silver color, this relatively common metal is said to contain the power of the moon's light. It seems to have special properties concerning creatures of the night.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Some metals are for jewelry. This metal is for war.'
FlavorText.Text2: In ore form, this unassuming metal is indistinguishable from common rock. However, when properly smelted and mixed with other metals to form various alloys, it is creates the most effective and durable weapons and armor in Lavato.

FlavorText.Text1: 'It's been called True Water, Undine's Wine, Alchemist's Friend... you'll know it when you see it.'
FlavorText.Text2: Extracting the essential water from a sample of sea or lake water is a fundamental exercise for beginning alchemists. Aquid is used as the base for all potion-making and other such magical endeavors.

FlavorText.Text1: 'You can't really pick up one of these crystals without having a sudden urge to stab a vampire.'
FlavorText.Text2: Crystallized sunlight that forms around ruined temples from the age of the Four Gods. It's not easy to find, but its use in magic makes it invaluable.

FlavorText.Text1: 'The power of the soul is only a mystery for those who have not held it in their hands.'
FlavorText.Text2: Concentrated soul energy is difficult to contain, but is invaluable for necromancers and golem-makers, who can use it to animate inanimnate objects -- even the famous Magic Dolls.

FlavorText.Text1: 'It's heat is immense. It could even burn a fire elemental.'
FlavorText.Text2: In Lavato, there is a chain of ancient volcanoes where perhaps the explosions that formed the continents originated. Deep within can be found an alchemical magma that does not cool, even when suspended in ice.

FlavorText.Text1: 'What a specimen! I feel like I can see the world reflected in its surface.'
FlavorText.Text2: A rare type of gemstone found in areas with heavy amounts of magical radiation. It has countless applications, most notably to make crystal balls for fortune tellers.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Holy power can benifit mankind or be a dangerous weapon.'
FlavorText.Text2: The legendary 'Pure Light,' an energy form made of concentrated magical sunlight. It is used to make the most powerful magical artifacts, including the famous holy weapon, Lantylit, the symbol of office for the leader of the Shrine Knights.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Working with this substance is an art form. Failing to do so well is suicide.'
FlavorText.Text2: Concentrated demon's blood is filled with unpredictale magic power, bits and pieces of souls, curses and the energy of darkness. It's difficult to work with, but unlimited strength is locked inside.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Truly, this is the heart of the mountain range, fond only in the bosom of the earth.'
FlavorText.Text2: A mysterious type of gemstone infused with the heart and soul of gaia, the power inherent in Lavato itself as a world. Holding even a tiny piece, one can feel the heartbeat of the stag, hear the trees grow and sense the weight of the mountain ranges settling.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Magic is part all things. But it doesn't have to be, you can separate it.'
FlavorText.Text2: Every wizard knows to manipulate the flow of mana to cast spells, but to actually extract pure mana energy from the flow and hold it in your hands is a truely unique skill. It is said that only the legendary beings known as 'Iczers' have mastered this technique.

Soul.Name: Consecutive Strikes
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to all enemy units. All enemy units get AGI-2 for this turn.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 5 or higher, this unit gets HP +30.

Skill0.Name: Double Axe Attack
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/rank up] Do [damage: AT 50%] to two random enemy units within range.

FlavorText.Text1: During the 2013 Kickstarter, Christopher contributed his take on the card 'Dual Axe Wielder.' drmcninja.com
FlavorText.Text2: Christopher is not only a webcomic artist with his successful Dr. McNinja, but has been writing some of the funniest Deadpool comics in a good long time for Marvel. He's a master of tried-and-true ninja vs. pirate humor, and has truly broken ground with his use of giant lumberjacks in the comic medium.

Soul.Name: Knight's Order
Soul.Comment: Engage one disengaged enemy unit. Increase your Refess LV by 1.

Skill0.Name: Sword of God
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT+10] to one random enemy unit in range. Return one random non-character unit card from your Cemetery to your File.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Perish in the name of the god of the True God Church, heathens!'
FlavorText.Text2: The True God Church began to maintain its own forces after the War of the Sun and Moon ended. It's said the knights of the church would follow the bands of priests who proselytized in neighboring countries, and carry out enlightenment campaigns.

Skill0.Name: Instant Revival
Skill0.Comment: Revive one closed unit of level 4 or below.

FlavorText.Text1: 'It's a miracle from the heavens.'
FlavorText.Text2: The priests of the Solar Kingdom wield many miracles, but this is by far the least understood. It can return the soul to the body after death.

Soul.Name: Rising Soul
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to one enemy unit. Send one random unit card from rival Iczer's Card File to the Cemetery.

Skill0.Name: Strike and Withdraw
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to one random enemy unit. Return this card to its Card File.

Skill1.Name: Cavalry Arrives
Skill1.Comment: The first time this skill activates, you get SP+1.

FlavorText.Text1: 'We've got to find the enemy before they find us! Keep looking!'
FlavorText.Text2: Flying troops fielded by the kingdom of Folrart. Their main purpose is to spot enemy troops, but if they must fight they will. With their flying ability, they are masters of flying in, striking, and then escaping.

Soul.Name: A Prayer for Peace
Soul.Comment: You get SP+2.

Skill0.Name: Selfless Sacrifice
Skill0.Comment: You get SP+2. This unit gets HP=0.

FlavorText.Text1: If it's for the sake of peace...my life is expendable!'
FlavorText.Text2: A female priest of the True God Church.  She has a devoted personality, and tries to help her allies by sacrificing herself.

Soul.Name: Toughen
Soul.Comment: All units get MAX HP+10.

Skill0.Name: Tracking them Down
Skill0.Comment: One random enemy with AGI 4 or higher gets AGI-2.

Skill1.Name: Man's Best Friend
Skill1.Comment: The LV3 or lower friendly directly behind this unit gets AT+10. Then, this unit is healed 10HP.

FlavorText.Text1: Our enemy is the enemy of all living things.  Is it so strange that they would take part, too?'
FlavorText.Text2: One of Kyle's 'team of two' plans.  The idea behind the plans is that two people can accomplish things one alone cannot.  In this case, the goal is increase one's ability to search for and pursue enemies by teaming up with a dog.

Soul.Name: Balanced Exchange
Soul.Comment: Send a friendly  directly to the Cemetery. Then, send a disengaged, enemy directly to the Cemetery.

Skill0.Name: Purification
Skill0.Comment: Remove up to 5 cards in Rival's cemetery from the game. Then, all friendlies are immune to other cards' effects that include engaging until the end of this turn.

Skill1.Name: Cast Out
Skill1.Comment: Subtract 60 from the MAXHP of target enemy in range.

FlavorText.Text1: It's just a hollow spirit, after all.  That makes it something of a child, to the exorcists.'
FlavorText.Text2: The Duchy of Crest has fought many battles against undead hosts, and it has pursued anti-undead military preparations that differ from those of the Solar Kingdom.  The most distinctive of these is the training of skilled exorcists.  Their techniques have the overwhelming power to send undead back to the world of the dead, and this became a big reason why Crest proved difficult to assault, despite its arms reduction.

Soul.Name: Dread and Weakness
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to two random enemy units. Rival  Iczer gets SP-1.

Skill0.Name: Spear of Wounding
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/Lawtia LV1 or higher] Subtract AT directly from the HP of an enemy in range. This unit gets AT+10. Decrease Lawtia LV by 1.

Skill1.Name: Abyssal Strike
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/Lawtia LV2 or higher] Do [damage: AT] to two random enemies. They get MAX HP=current HP. Decrease your Lawtia LV by 2.

FlavorText.Text1: 'If you hear a clip-clop sound, hide under some handy corpses and cover your mouth and nose.  If you don't, you'll end up like me...'
FlavorText.Text2: A dead knight who appears on the battlefield night after night. Riding a headless horse, he's been feared as a symbol of death since ancient times. When night falls, he appears at a specific point, heralded by the sound of hooves, then sets about taking the lives of any present, and vanishes into the darkness once every human is dead.

Soul.Name: Soul Absorption
Soul.Comment: Return one card from your Cemetery to your Card File, Return two cards from Rival Iczer's Cemetery to his Card File.

Skill0.Name: Refresh
Skill0.Comment: Send [card: Lich] from your Card File to the Cemetery and then, this unit fully recovers its HP.

Skill1.Name: Arise, Undead Horde
Skill1.Comment: Return four random [cardtype: undead] cards from your Cemetery to your Card File.

FlavorText.Text1: 'It's like the boss of all undead. If you happen to see one, you should just run.'
FlavorText.Text2: When a high-ranking priest or wizard turns evil after death, it becomes a high-ranking undead, a Lich. It can think more logically than other undead and possesses strong magic powers.

Soul.Name: Triggered Alarm
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to all enemies. All friendlies get DF+5.

Skill0.Name: Shield Synthesis
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets DF +[Rival's SP X10] for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Lancer
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to a column of enemies in range.

FlavorText.Text1: Intruder detected within guarded area.  Initiating shift from guard mode to repellence mode.'
FlavorText.Text2: The latest model of Magic Doll, developed by the newly formed Alchemist Guild within the Duchy of Crest.  The single absolute creator, Sumer, has gone missing, but her research was not lost, and the alchemists used it as a basis to begin developing Magic Dolls.  This Knight Model is considered their first masterpiece.  Unlike previous Magic Dolls, models made with versatility in mind performed well in combat against the undead.

Soul.Name: Defenders of Nations
Soul.Comment: Increase your Gowen level by 3.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 5 or higher, this unit gets AT +10, AGI +1.

Skill0.Name: Get Behind Me
Skill0.Comment: [conditional use/Rank Up] The unit directly behind this unit gets AT+10 and +1 AGI for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Flash of the Blade
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT+1->20] to two random enemy units in range.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Our job is to maintain the peace through force of arms.'
FlavorText.Text2: After peace was announced, major disputes no longer broke out between the nations of Lavato. But the Cursed Legions, led by Durendal, appear as the enemy of all mankind. Heierrat fights the Cursed Legions on behalf of the nations impoverished by the war, and becomes renowned as the nation that defends nations.

Soul.Name: Mass Impale
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 40] to a random column of enemy units.

Skill0.Name: Brutal Goring
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT X 2] to a random enemy column in range. This unit is healed 40 HP and engaged until the end of next turn.

FlavorText.Text1: 'Run if you have to, just not in a straight line.'
FlavorText.Text2: There are monsters that have been living deep in the eldritch forests since ancient times. They're very territorial, and attack anything that enters their domain.

Soul.Name: Below the Thunders
Soul.Comment: Engage one random unit.

Skill0.Name: Release the Kraken
Skill0.Comment: You may not Set a [card: The Kraken] next turn.

Skill1.Name: Tentacles Rise
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/ 6 or more [subtype: Monster] in the Cemetery] Do [damage: 80] to target enemy.

Skill2.Name: Tentacles Fall
Skill2.Comment: [conditional use/ 6 or more [subtype: Monster] in the Cemetery] Do [pierce damage: 80] to target enemy.

Skill3.Name: Submerged in the Depths
Skill3.Comment: Return this unit to the Card File.

FlavorText.Text1: 'All manner of dangers lurk in the night sea. Storms and pirates that fall upon you like a whim, and then there's the kraken.'
FlavorText.Text2: A giant ocean beast that appears by night, rising up from the deepest, darkest depths. It's said its mere arrival causes a storm to start, and it attacks ships laden with treasure. It also possesses an unexpectedly high level of intelligence, and they say it can understand human speech.

Soul.Name: Right Between the Eyes
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: Gowen X 10] to target disengaged enemy unit.

RankUp.Name: Rank Up
RankUp.Comment: If you have a Gowen level of 6 or higher, this unit gets HP +10, AGI +1, RNG +1.

Skill0.Name: Charge
Skill0.Comment: Do [damage: AT x 2] to a random enemy unit within range. Do [damage: 50% of MAX HP] to this unit.

Skill1.Name: Pinpoint
Skill1.Comment: [conditional use/rank up] Do [damage: AT] to a target enemy unit within range.

FlavorText.Text1: 'What is with this army of girls?'
FlavorText.Text2: Swordsmen of the Mercenary Nation. They use special weapons called Revolver Blades. Ready to challenge an experienced troop on the battlefield, they're surprised to see the enemy is an army of Magic Dolls.

Soul.Name: Aquamantic Displacement
Soul.Comment: Choose one open Area on the enemy field. Move target enemy unit into the chosen area. Engage that unit.

Skill0.Name: Aqua Magic
Skill0.Comment: One enemy unit gets AGI-1.

Skill1.Name: Mermaid Spear
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to target enemy unit in range. This unit gets AGI+1 and RNG+1.

Skill2.Name: Defending New Regus
Skill2.Comment: [conditional use/AGI 5 or higher] Two friendly [subtype: Wizard Kingdom] units are fully healed, except this unit.

FlavorText.Text1: 'I have a place where I belong on the surface now, and I'm going to defend it.'
FlavorText.Text2: A former mermaid soldier who joined the Wizard Kingdom. After the War ends, Vonderam lifts the ban on cultural exchange between the mermaids and the surface. At first he declares the reason for this is to learn the intentions of humanity, but his real objective is revealed during the War of the Emperor of the Silver Sun.

Skill0.Name: Aqua Armor
Skill0.Comment: Target friendly gets AGI+1. All friendlies get AGI+1 and get DF= [DF+AGI x5] for this turn.

FlavorText.Text1: This armor has overwhelming strength, and wonderful flexibility.'
FlavorText.Text2: Sorcery that produces magic armor from water.  The fixed water repels enemy blades using magic power, but as it's water, it's nearly weightless, and as the wearer can move around easily, it's often used by wizard soldiers.

Soul.Name: Triggered Alarm
Soul.Comment: Do [damage: 20] to all enemies. All friendlies get DF+5.

Skill0.Name: Shield Synthesis
Skill0.Comment: This unit gets DF +[Rival's SP X10] for this turn.

Skill1.Name: Lancer
Skill1.Comment: Do [damage: AT] to a column of enemies in range.

FlavorText.Text1: Intruder detected within guarded area.  Initiating shift from guard mode to repellent mode.'
FlavorText.Text2: The latest model of Magic Doll, developed by the newly formed Alchemist Guild within the Duchy of Crest.  The single absolute creator, Sumer, has gone missing, but her research was not lost, and the alchemists used it as a basis to begin developing Magic Dolls.  This Knight Model is considered their first masterpiece.  Unlike previous Magic Dolls, models made with versatility in mind performed well in combat against the undead.
